title: Terraform Networking: Design Multi-AZ VPC Strategy
description: Analyze requirements from REQ-1-046 and design the VPC layout, including CIDR blocks, public/private subnet allocation across two AZs, and routing strategy.
sprint_goal: Establish foundational infrastructure, user authentication, and core application shell.
acceptance_criteria: A network diagram and design document is created and approved. CIDR ranges are finalized.
definition_of_done: Design review approved by tech lead.
business_value: Enables secure and scalable network foundation for the application.

title: Terraform Networking: Implement VPC, Subnets, and Gateways
description: Write Terraform code to provision the VPC, public/private subnets across two AZs, Internet Gateway, and NAT Gateways as per the design.
sprint_goal: Establish foundational infrastructure, user authentication, and core application shell.
acceptance_criteria: Terraform `plan` matches the approved design. Resources are successfully provisioned in the `dev` environment.
definition_of_done: Successful `terraform apply` and AWS console verification.

title: Terraform Cognito: Implement User Pool and Password Policy
description: Write Terraform code to provision the AWS Cognito User Pool, defining the strict password policy as per REQ-1-071.
sprint_goal: Establish foundational infrastructure, user authentication, and core application shell.
acceptance_criteria: Terraform apply creates the Cognito User Pool. Password policy in AWS console matches REQ-1-071.

title: Ensure a seamless and functional user experience across all device sizes
description: As any user, I want the application's interface to adapt seamlessly to my device's screen size, so that I can have a productive and frustration-free experience whether I'm using a mobile phone, tablet, or desktop computer.
sprint_goal: Establish foundational infrastructure, user authentication, and core application shell.
acceptance_criteria: Layout must render in a single-column on mobile (<768px). Layout must utilize horizontal space on desktop (>1024px). Layout must transition smoothly on orientation change.
definition_of_done: E2E tests pass on mobile and desktop viewports. Manual testing completed on physical devices. Accessibility audit passes.
testing_requirements: Component, E2E, Accessibility, Manual Cross-Browser/Device Testing
deployment_notes: Foundational for all other UI stories.
business_value: Increases user reach, satisfaction, and retention by providing a consistent, high-quality experience on any device.

title: Register for a new user account
description: As a prospective user, I want to create a secure personal account using my email and a strong password, while accepting the terms of service, so that I can save my data and access it from any device.
sprint_goal: Establish foundational infrastructure, user authentication, and core application shell.
acceptance_criteria: Successful registration with valid credentials. Registration attempt with an existing email fails with specific error. Registration with a weak password fails with policy error.
definition_of_done: E2E tests for registration happy path and key error states are implemented and passing. Security review confirms secure handling of credentials.
business_value: Enables user-specific data persistence, which increases user retention and engagement.

title: Log in to an existing user account
description: As a returning user, I want to securely log in using my email and password to access my saved data and continue my work.
sprint_goal: Establish foundational infrastructure, user authentication, and core application shell.
acceptance_criteria: Successful login with valid credentials redirects to main view with data loaded. Login with incorrect password shows a generic error. Already logged-in user is redirected from login page.
definition_of_done: E2E test for the happy path login flow is implemented and passing. Security review completed for token handling (PKCE flow).
deployment_notes: Implements the client-side of the PKCE auth flow.
business_value: Enables user-specific data persistence and personalization, which is critical for user retention and engagement.

title: Perform basic arithmetic operations
description: As a General User, I want to perform addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division using a clear interface, so that I can accurately and efficiently solve basic mathematical problems.
sprint_goal: Establish foundational infrastructure, user authentication, and core application shell.
acceptance_criteria: Simple addition '5+3' results in '8'. Order of operations '5+3*2' results in '11'. Division by zero shows a non-destructive error.
definition_of_done: Unit tests for calculation logic at >90% coverage. UI is responsive and accessible. Performance of <50ms for UI updates is verified.
deployment_notes: Foundation for all other calculator features.
business_value: Establishes the core, non-negotiable functionality of the calculator.

title: Terraform DB: Implement Multi-AZ Encrypted RDS Instance
description: Write Terraform for the RDS instance based on REQ-1-046, REQ-1-047, and REQ-1-044, including Multi-AZ, encryption, and backup policies.
sprint_goal: Implement core scientific calculator functions and establish the backend database and CI/CD testing.
acceptance_criteria: RDS instance is provisioned in Multi-AZ. Storage encryption is enabled. Backup retention is 14 days with PITR.
definition_of_done: Successful `terraform apply` and verification of all settings in the AWS RDS console.
deployment_notes: Provisions the primary data store for the application.
business_value: Ensures high availability, durability, and security for all user data.

title: Input numbers using SI prefixes
description: As an electronics engineer, I want to input numerical values using standard SI prefixes like 'k' for kilo and 'n' for nano, so that I can enter calculations quickly and accurately.
sprint_goal: Implement core scientific calculator functions and establish the backend database and CI/CD testing.
acceptance_criteria: Expression '1.2k + 3M' calculates to 3001200. Expression '500m + 10μ' calculates to 0.50001. Invalid case '10K' results in a syntax error.
definition_of_done: Unit tests for parsing logic have at least 90% coverage. UI includes a 'μ' button. In-app help is updated.
deployment_notes: Requires modification of the core expression parser.
business_value: Enhances user efficiency and reduces input errors for the target audience.

title: Persist calculation history across sessions for registered users
description: As a registered user, I want my calculation history to be automatically saved to my account so that I can access it from any device at any time, ensuring my work is never lost.
sprint_goal: Deliver persistent user data by implementing calculation history and user-defined variables for registered users.
acceptance_criteria: User's history is loaded upon login. New calculations are persisted to the backend. Offline calculations are queued and synced upon reconnection.
definition_of_done: E2E tests covering happy path and offline synchronization scenario are implemented and passing. Security review confirms data segregation.
business_value: Increases user retention and encourages account registration by transforming the application from a stateless tool into a persistent, multi-device workspace.

title: Manage defined variables by updating or deleting them
description: As a registered user, I want to be able to edit the value of an existing variable and delete variables I no longer need, so that I can maintain an accurate and organized list of variables.
sprint_goal: Complete the core data management features and achieve a fully deployable backend service.
acceptance_criteria: Successfully update a variable's value and persist to backend. Successfully delete a variable after confirmation. API returns an error during an update/delete failure.
definition_of_done: API integration tests for PUT/DELETE endpoints are passing. E2E tests for success and failure scenarios are implemented. All UI elements meet accessibility standards.
business_value: Improves data integrity for the user and increases the utility of the variable persistence feature.

title: Write formulas for a custom mode
description: As a registered user creating a custom calculation mode, I want to write mathematical formulas that connect my defined input variables to my output variables, so that I can define the core logic of my custom calculator.
sprint_goal: Implement the core logic for the Custom Mode feature by building the formula editor with real-time validation.
acceptance_criteria: User enters a valid formula using defined variables and it is accepted. User enters a formula with an undefined variable and sees an error. User enters a formula with a disallowed function (e.g., 'eval') and sees an error.
definition_of_done: Unit tests for the formula parser/validator achieve >90% coverage. E2E tests for the formula step in the wizard are passing. Security review of the parsing logic is complete.
deployment_notes: Critical path for the entire custom mode feature.
business_value: This is the core functionality of the user-extensible framework, a key product differentiator.

title: Automatically sync offline data upon reconnection
description: As a registered user, I want the application to automatically save any new calculations or variable changes I make while offline and sync them to my account when I reconnect.
sprint_goal: Deliver a robust offline experience by implementing service worker caching and automatic data synchronization for registered users.
acceptance_criteria: Sync new calculation history created while offline. Conflict resolution for variable update uses last-write-wins. System gracefully handles synchronization failure and retries.
definition_of_done: E2E tests that simulate offline conditions are passing. Conflict resolution logic is explicitly demonstrated to work. UI for sync status is approved.
deployment_notes: Critical for reliability and user trust.
business_value: Increases user trust, data integrity, and application reliability. Reduces user friction and potential data loss.

title: Ensure Full Application Compatibility with Screen Readers for Visually Impaired Users
description: As a user who relies on a screen reader, I want the entire application to be fully described and operable via my screen reader, so that I can independently and efficiently perform calculations.
sprint_goal: Achieve full WCAG 2.1 AA compliance by implementing comprehensive keyboard-only navigation and screen reader compatibility across the entire application.
acceptance_criteria: Screen reader announces all major landmark regions and interactive elements have descriptive labels. Dynamic content and calculation results are announced immediately. All features are operable using only the keyboard.
definition_of_done: The application passes a full WCAG 2.1 Level AA audit with no critical or serious violations. Automated accessibility checks are integrated into the CI pipeline. A formal accessibility testing checklist is created.
testing_requirements: Manual testing with NVDA/VoiceOver, Automated tools (Axe), Full keyboard-only E2E test
deployment_notes: Cross-cutting concern affecting all UI components.
business_value: Ensures the application is inclusive and accessible to users with visual impairments, meeting legal and ethical obligations under WCAG 2.1 AA.
